meanings.definition: A quantity of medicine or drug taken at one time
meanings.sent1: She took a dose of cough syrup before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed a dose of antibiotics for the infection.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally knocked over the bottle of medicine, spilling the dose.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a dose of bitter medicine, hard to swallow but necessary.
meanings.sent5: The dose of pain relief brought instant comfort to the patient.

meanings.sent1: A dose of sugar is enough to sweeten the tea.
meanings.sent2: He added a dose of humor to his presentation to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent3: The dose of laughter from the audience was music to the comedian's ears.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a dose of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: A dose of courage helped him face his fears.

meanings.definition: To administer a dose of medicine or drug to someone
meanings.sent1: The nurse will dose the patient with the prescribed medication.
meanings.sent2: He carefully dosed out the painkillers to avoid an overdose.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog managed to dose himself with the treats left on the table.
meanings.sent4: She dosed her plants with fertilizer to help them grow stronger.
meanings.sent5: The coach will dose the players with energy drinks before the game.
